## CES-D vs CAST

Software Psychologists, therapists, and researchers looking to compare the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression (CES-D) and the Cannabis Abuse Screening Test (CAST) can leverage the power of the Harmony software. The unique design of Harmony is intentional to aid professionals in the field make seamless comparisons such as 'CES-D vs CAST', saving them valuable time. The software ultimately enhances their research process by streamlining the harmonisation phase. Central to the success of Harmony's operational capability is its advanced natural language processing and generative AI models. When comparing CES-D and CAST, Harmony uses these technologies to match and/or correlate questionnaire items from the two different tests. Thus, the tedious task of manually matching and comparing such data now has a more efficient and reliable option with the 'CES-D vs CAST' feature of Harmony. Another remarkable quality Harmony offers in the 'CES-D vs CAST' comparison effort is its proficiency in dealing with multiple languages. This is an extraordinarily beneficial feature, especially in times when the global aspect of research initiatives is continually increasing. Harmony software ensures that in a 'CES-D vs CAST' exercise, language no longer stands as a barrier but instead becomes a bridge in generating comprehensive and comparative studies. Using Harmony guarantees a more harmonised approach to understanding the different aspects of psychological and social scientific studies.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and CAST

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and CAST into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just CAST into Harmony</a> - compare CAST with other instruments
